speaker: Captain
lines: Take it easy, Woyzeck, take it easy!  One thing at a time.  You’re making me dizzy.  You’re going to finish early today – what am I supposed to do with the extra ten minutes?  Woyzeck, just think, you’ve still got a good thirty years to live, thirty years!  That’s 360 months, and days, hours, minutes!  What are you going to do with that ungodly amount of time? Have you ever thought about it, Woyzeck?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Yes,  sir, captain.

speaker: Captain
lines: I fear for the world when I think about eternity.  Busyness, Woyzeck, Busyness!  Eternal – that’s eternal – that is-­‐ eternal – you realize that, of course.  But then again it’s not eternal, it’s only a moment, yes a moment.  Woyzeck, it frightens me to think that the earth rotates in one day.  What a waste of time!  What will come of that? Woyzeck, I can’t look at a mill wheel anymore or I get melancholy.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Yes, captain.

speaker: Captain
lines: Woyzeck, you always look so upset.  A good man doesn’t act like that, a good man with a good conscience.  Say something, Woyzeck. What’s the weather like?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: It’s bad Captain, bad – wind.

speaker: Captain
lines: I can fell it, there’s something rapid out there.  A wind like that has the same effect on me as a mouse.  (Cunningly) I believe it’s coming from the south – north.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Yes Captain

speaker: Captain
lines: Ha ha ha!  South – north!  Ha ha ha!  Oh, he’s a stupid one. Horribly stupid!  (Moved) Woyzeck, you’re a good man, a good man – (with dignity) but Woyzeck, you’ve got no morality.  Morality – that’s when you are moral, you understand?  It’s a good word.  You have a child without the blessing of the church, as our Reverend Chaplain says….

speaker: Sergeant
lines: Without the blessing of the church!

speaker: Captain
lines: I didn’t make that up.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Captain, the good lord isn’t going to look at a poor soul only because amen was said over it before it was created.  The lord said: “Suffer little children to come unto me.”

speaker: Captain
lines: What’s that you’re saying? What kind of crazy answer is that? You’re getting me all confused.  When I say you, I mean you – you!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Us poor people.  You see, Captain – money, money.  If you don’t have money……just try to raise your own kind on morality in this world.  After all, we’re flesh and blood.  The likes of us are unhappy in this world and the next.  I guess if we ever got to heaven, we’d have to help with the thunder.

speaker: Captain
lines: Woyzeck, you have no virtue. You’re not a virtuous person. Flesh and blood? When I’m lying at the window after it has rained, and I watch the white laced stockings as they go tripping down the street – damn it, Woyzeck, then love comes all over me.  I’ve got flesh and blood, too.  But Woyzeck, virtue, virtue!  How else could I make time go by?  I always say to myself, “You’re a virtuous man, (sentimentally) a good man, a good man.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Yes, Captain, Virtue!  I haven’t figured it out yet.  You see, us common people, we don’t have virtue.  We act like nature tells us.  But if I had a nice hat and a watch, and a warm coat and I knew all the proper words, I could be virtuous too.  Virtue seems nice, Captain.  However, I’m just a poor soul.

speaker: Captain
lines: That’s fine, Woyzeck.  You’re a good man, a good man.  But you think too much, that’s unhealthy.  You always look so upset. This discussion has really worn me out.  You can go now – and don’t run! Slowly, nice and slow down the street.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Andres?  Hey Andres?  That streak across the grass – that’s where heads roll at night.  Once somebody picked one up, though it was a hedgehog.  Three days and three nights, and he was lying in a coffin. (Softly) Andres, the communists. That’s it – the communists! Shh!

speaker: Andres
lines: (sings)

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Shh!  Something’s moving!

speaker: Andres
lines: (sings)

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Something’s moving behind me – under me. (stamps on the ground)  Hollow!  You hear that?  It’s all hollow down there.  The communists!

speaker: Andres
lines: You’re frightening me.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: It’s so quiet – that’s strange.  You feel like holding your breath. Andres!

speaker: Andres
lines: What?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Say something (stares off) Andres!  Look how bright it is! There’s fire raging around the sky, and noise is coming down like trumpets.  It’s coming closer!  Let’s go!  Don’t look back!  (drags him off)

speaker: Andres
lines: (after a pause) Woyzeck!  Do you still hear it?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Quiet, everything’s quite, like the world was dead.

speaker: Andres
lines: Listen!  They’re drumming.  We’ve got to get back!

speaker: Marie
lines: (encouraging her son) Hey, look there!  Ta-­‐ra-­‐ra-­‐ ra!  You hear it? They’re coming.

speaker: Margaret
lines: What a man, like a tree!

speaker: Marie
lines: He stands on his feet like a lion. (Drum Major salutes them)

speaker: Margaret
lines: Say, what a friendly look you gave him, neighbor.  We’re not used to that from you.

speaker: Marie
lines: (sings)

speaker: Margaret
lines: You eyes are still shining.

speaker: Marie
lines: So what?  Why don’t you take your eyes to the jeweler and have them polished – maybe they’ll shine enough to sell as two buttons.

speaker: Margaret
lines: What?  Why, Mrs. Virgin!  I’m a decent woman, but you – you could stare through seven pairs of leather pants!

speaker: Marie
lines: Bitch!  Come on boy.  What do they want from us, anyway? You’re only the son of a whore, and you make you mother happy with your bastard face! Ta-­‐ta (sings)

speaker: Marie
lines: Who’s that?  Is that you, Franz?  Come on in!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I can’t stay. Have to go to roll call.

speaker: Marie
lines: What’s the matter with you, Franz?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Marie, there was something out there again – a lot!  Isn’t it written: “And lo, the smoke of the country went up as the smoke of a furnace?”

speaker: Marie
lines: Franz….

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: It followed me until I reached town.  What’s going to happen?

speaker: Marie
lines: Franz

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I’ve got to go. (leaves)

speaker: Marie
lines: That man!  He’s seeing things.  He didn’t even look at his own child. He’ll go crazy with those thoughts of his. Why are you so quiet, son?  Are you scared?  It’s getting so dark, you’d think you were blind. Only that street lamp shining in from outside.  (sings)

speaker: Marie
lines: My god, when fools still have their senses, then we’re all fools. Oh, what a mad world!  What a beautiful world!

speaker: Barker
lines: Ladies and gentlemen, ladies and gentlemen, come one, come all, marvel and behold the monkey!  Come see this creature as god made it, he’s nothing, nothing at all. See the effect of art: he walks upright, wears coat and pants, carries a sword!  Ho! The monkey is musical. Ladies and gentlemen, here is to be seen the astronomical horse and the cannery-­‐birds – they’re favorites of all potentates of Europe – they are members of all learned societies.  Observe the progress of civilization. Everything progresses – a horse, a monkey, a cannery-­‐bird!  The monkey is already a soldier.  That’s not much – it’s the lowest level of the human race.  Enter!  The presentation will begin.  The commencement of the beginning will start immediately.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Want to?

speaker: Marie
lines: All right.  It ought to be good.  Look at the tassels on him!  And his wife’s got pants on!

speaker: Sergeant
lines: Hold it!  Over there, look at her!  My god she’s a piece! Drum Major: Goddamm!  Good enough for the propagation of cavalry regiments and the breeding of drum majors!

speaker: Sergeant
lines: Look how she holds her head-­‐ you’d think that red hair would pull her down like a weight.  And those eyes, black…. Drum Major: It’s like looking down a well or a chimney.  Come, after her!

speaker: Marie
lines: Those lights!  My eyes!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Yeah, like a barrel of black cats with fiery eyes.  Strange night.

speaker: Announcer
lines: Show your talent!  Show your beastly wisdom.  Put human society to shame.  Gentlemen, this animal that you see here, with a tail, with his four hoofs, is a member of all learned societies, is a professor of philosophy at our university with whom the students learn to ride and fight. That is simple intelligence. Now think with double reason. What do you do when you think with double raison? Is there in the learned society an ass? (Horse shakes it’s head) Now you understand double reason? Raison? That’s beastiognomy.  Yes, this is no dumb animal, a person!  A human being, a beastly human being, but still an animal, une bête!  (Horse defecates) That’s right, put society to shame.  You see, the beast is still nature, not ideal nature of course.  Take a lesson from him! But ask your doctor first, it may prove highly dangerous.  What we have been told by this is: Man must be natural!  We are created of dust, sand, and dung.  Why must you be more than dust, sand, and dung?  Observe his reason: he can add, but he can’t count on his fingers.  How come? He simply can’t express himself, explain himself.  A metamorphosed human being.  Tell the gentlemen what time it is!  Which of you has a watch – a watch?

speaker: Sergeant
lines: A watch? (Slowly and grandly he pulls a watch out of his pocket) There you are.

speaker: Marie
lines: This I’ve got to see. (She climbs over the stage.  The Drum Major helps her)

speaker: Announcer
lines: Eight o’clock!  I ask you, is that not remarkable?  Ladies and gentlemen, this amazing feat concludes the performance.  Thank you all, thank you!

speaker: Sergeant
lines: Give the man a hand, soldier.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Yes Sergeant. (Woyzeck helps the announcer with horse and tent)

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (Left alone) Marie?  Marie? (Exits)

speaker: Marie
lines: These stones really sparkle!  What kind are they?  What did he call them? Go to sleep, son! Shut your eyes tight (The child covers his eyes with his hands.) Tighter – stay quiet or he’ll come get you (Sings) It must be gold.  The likes of us only have a little corner in the world and a little piece of mirror, but my mouth is just as red as the great ladies with their mirrors from top to toe, and handsome lords who kiss their hands.  I’m just a poor woman. (Child sits up) Shh, son, eyes shut!  Look, the sandman!  He’s running along the wall.  Eyes shut, or he’ll look into them, and you’ll go blind.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: What’s that you got there?

speaker: Marie
lines: Nothing

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Something’s shining under your fingers.

speaker: Marie
lines: An earring.  I found it.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I’ve never found anything like that.  Two at once.

speaker: Marie
lines: What am I – a whore?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: It’s all right, Marie.  Look, the boy’s asleep.  Lift him up under his arms, the chair’s hurting him.  Those shiny drops on his forehead; everything under the sun is work.  Sweat, even in our sleep.  Life in poverty.  Here’s some more money, Marie, my pay and some from the captain.

speaker: Marie
lines: God love you Franz.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I have to go.  See you tonight, Marie. Bye.

speaker: Marie
lines: (Long pause) Such a bitch.  Why are you such a whore?  I could stab myself.  What a world!  Everything goes to hell anyhow, man and woman alike.

speaker: Doctor
lines: I don’t believe it, Woyzeck!  And a man of your word!  A man of honor?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: What is it, Doctor?

speaker: Doctor
lines: I saw it Woyzeck. You pissed on the street, you pissed on the wall like a dog.  A horse piss! And you get two cents a day.  Woyzeck, that’s bad.  The world’s getting bad, very bad.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: But Doctor, the call of nature….

speaker: Doctor
lines: The call of nature, the call of nature? Nature!  Haven’t I proved that the musculus constrictor vesicae is subject to the will? Nature? Woyzeck, man is free.  In man alone is individuality exalted to freedom. Couldn’t hold it in? (Begins to pace) Did you eat your peas already Woyzeck?  Nothing bu peas!! I’m revolutionizing science, I’ll blow it sky-­‐high.  Urea Oxygen. Ammonium hydrochloratem hyperoxidie.  Woyzeck, couldn’t you just try to piss again? (He empties a piss jar and hands it to him) Go over there and try.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I can’t, Doctor.

speaker: Doctor
lines: (Disturbed) But you could piss on the wall? I have it here in black and white.  Here’s the contract.  I saw it all – saw it with my own eyes.  I had my nose in the air, letting the sun’s rays hit it, so as to examine the process of sneezing. (Goes up to him) No, Woyzeck, I’m not getting angry.  Anger is unhealthy, unscientific.  I am calm, perfectly calm.  My pulse is beating at it’s usual sixty, and I tell you this in all cold-­‐bloodedness.  Now, who would get excited about a human being, a human being? If it were a Proteus that were dying……!  But you shouldn’t have pissed on the wall.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: You see, Doctor, sometimes you’ve got a certain character, a certain structure.  But with nature, that’s something else, you see, with nature. That’s like…. how should I put it…. for example……

speaker: Doctor
lines: Woyzeck, you’re philosophizing again.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Doctor, have you ever seen anthing of double nature?  When the sun’s standing high at noon and the world seems to be going up in flames, I”ve heard a terrible voice talking to me!

speaker: Doctor
lines: Woyzeck, you’ve got an aberratio!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (Puts finger to his nose) The toadstools, Doctor. There – that’s where it is.  Have you seen how they grow in patterns?  If only someone could read that.

speaker: Doctor
lines: Woyzeck, you’ve got a marvelous aberration mentalis partialis, second species, beautifully developed.  Woyzeck, you’re getting a raise. Second species: fixed idea with a generally rational condition.  You’re doing everything as usual? Shaving your captain?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Yes, sir.

speaker: Doctor
lines: Eating your peas?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Same as ever…….

speaker: Doctor
lines: Only peas!!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Only peas Doctor.  My wife gets the money for the household.

speaker: Doctor
lines: Going on duty?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Yes sir.

speaker: Doctor
lines: You’re an interesting case.  Subject Woyzeck,  you’re getting a raise. Now behave yourself. Show me your pulse! Yes. Very interesting case, subject Woyzeck. Drum Major: Marie!

speaker: Marie
lines: (Looking at him expressively) Go, march up and down for me.  A chest like a bull and a and a face so chiseled.  Nobody else is like that. No woman is prouder than me. Drum Major: Sundays when I have my plumed helmet and my white gloves – goddamn, Marie!  The prince always says: man, you’re quite a guy!

speaker: Marie
lines: (Mockingly) Aw, go on!  (Goes up to him) What a man! Drum Major: What a woman!  Hell, let’s breed a race of drum majors, hey? (He embraces her)

speaker: Marie
lines: Leave me alone. Drum Major: You wildcat!

speaker: Marie
lines: (Violently) Just try to touch me! Drum Major: You’ve got the devil in your eyes.

speaker: Marie
lines: What do I care. What does it matter?! (She gives in)

speaker: Captain
lines: Doctor, I feel sorry for horses when I think that the poor beasts have to go everywhere on foot.  Don’t run like that!  Don’t wave your cane around in the air like that!  You’ll run yourself to death that way.  A good man with a good conscience doesn’t go so fast.  A good man……(he catches the Doctor by the Coat) Doctor, allow me to save a human life. You’re racing……Doctor, I’m so melancholy.  I get so emotional.  I always start crying when I see my coat hanging on the wall – there it is.

speaker: Doctor
lines: Hm…. bloated, fat, thick neck, apoplectic constitution.  Yes Captain, you might be striken by an apoplexia cerbralis.  But you might get it just on one side and be half paralyzed, or – best of all – you might become mentally affected and just vegetate from then on.  Those are approximately your prospects for the next four weeks.  Moreover, I can assure you that you will be a most interesting case, and if, God willing you tongue is partially paralyzed, we’ll make immortal experiments.

speaker: Captain
lines: Doctor, don’t frighten me! People have been known to die of fright, of pure, sheer fright. I can see them now, with flowers in their hands – but they’ll say, he was a good man, a good man.  You damn coffin nail!

speaker: Doctor
lines: (Holds out his hat) What’s this, Captain?  That’s brain-­‐less!

speaker: Captain
lines: (makes a crease in the hat) What’s this, Doctor? That’s increase!

speaker: Doctor
lines: I take my leave, most honorable Mr. Drillprick.

speaker: Captain
lines: Likewise, dearest Mr. Coffin Nail.

speaker: Captain
lines: Hey, Woyzeck, why are you running past us like that? Stay here, Woyzeck.  You’re running around like an open razor blade.  You might cut someone!  You’re running like you had to shave a regiment of castrates and would be hanged while the last hair was disappearing. But about those long beards – what was I going to say?  Woyzeck – those long beards…….

speaker: Doctor
lines: A long beard on the chin.  Pliny speaks of it.  Soldiers should be made to give them up.

speaker: Captain
lines: (Continues) Hey? What about those long beards? Say, Woyzeck, haven’t you found a hair from a beard in you soulp bowl yet? Hey? You understand of course, a human hair, from the beard of an engineer, a sergeant, a – a drum major? Hey, Woyzeck? But you’ve got a decent wife.  Not like others.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Yes, sir!  What are you trying to say, Cap’n?

speaker: Captain
lines: Look at the face he’s making!  Now, it doesn’t necessarily have to be in the soup, but if you hurry around the corner, you might find one on a pair of lips – a pair of lips, Woyzeck. I know what love is, too, Woyzeck. Say, you’re white as chalk!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Cap’n, I’m just a poor devil – and that’s all I have in the world. Cap’n if you joking….

speaker: Captain
lines: Joking? Me? What do you think you are?

speaker: Doctor
lines: Your pulse, Woyzeck, your pulse – short, hard, skipping, irregular.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Cap’n the earth is hot as hell – for me it’s ice cold! Ice cold – hell is cold, I’ll bet.  It can’t be……god…….god.  It can’t be.

speaker: Captain
lines: Listen fellow, how’d you like to be shot, how’d you like to have a couple of bullets in your head? You’re looking daggers at me; but I only mean well, because you’re a good man, Woyzeck, a good man.

speaker: Doctor
lines: Facial muscles rigid, tense, occasionally twitching.  Posture erect, tense.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I’m going.  A lot is possible. A man.  A lot is possible.  The weather’s nice cap’n.  Look: such a beautiful, hard, rough sky – you’d almost feel like pounding a block of wood into it and hanging yourself on it, only because of the hyphen between yes, and yes again – and no. Cap’n, yes and no? Is no to blame for yes, or yes for no? I’ll have to think about that.  (Goes off with long strides, first slowly, then ever faster)

speaker: Doctor
lines: (Races after him) A phenomenon!  Woyzeck!  Another raise!

speaker: Captain
lines: These people make me dizzy.  Look at them go – that tall rascal takes off like the shadow before a spider, and the short one – he’s trotting along.  The tall one is lightning and the short one is thunder. Ha-­‐ha.  After them.  Grotesque…….grotesque.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (stares at her, shakes her head) Hm!  I don’t see anything, I don’t see anything.  I should be able to see it;  I should be able to grab it with my fists.

speaker: Marie
lines: (Intimidated) Whats the matter Franz?  You ‘re out of your mind Franz.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: A sin so fat and so wide – it stinks enough to smoke the angels out of heaven.  You’ve got a red mouth Marie.  No blister on it? Good-­‐bye Marie.  You’re as beautiful as sin.  Can mortal sin be so beautiful?

speaker: Marie
lines: Franz, you’re delirious.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Damn it!  Was he standing here like this, like this?

speaker: Marie
lines: As the day is long and the world is old, lots of people can stand on one spot, one after another.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I say him!

speaker: Marie
lines: You can see all sorts of things if you’ve got two eyes and aren’t blind, and the sun is shining.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: With my own eyes!

speaker: Marie
lines: So what!  (grabs child and exits)

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Andres!

speaker: Andres
lines: Huh?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (pause) Nice weather.

speaker: Andres
lines: Sunday weather.  There’s music outside town.  All the broads are out there already, everybody’s sweating – it’s really moving along.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (restlessly) A dance, Andres.  They’re dancing? Andres: Yeah, at the Horse and the at the Star.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Dancing, dancing.

speaker: Andres
lines: Big deal. (Plays and sings)

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Andres, I can’t keep still.

speaker: Andres
lines: Stupid.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I’ve got to get out of here.  I can’t see straight.  Dancing, dancing.  With their hot hands.  Damn it Andres!

speaker: Andres
lines: What do you want?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I’ve got to go.

speaker: Andres
lines: With that broad?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I’ve got to get out.  It’s so hot in here.

speaker: Andres
lines: Fucking slut. Journeyman 1: (Interrupting) Brother, shall I in friendship bore a hole in your head? Onward, I want to bore a hole in your nature.  I’m a force, a force of nature, you know.  I’m going to kill all the fleas on his body. Journeyman 2: My soul, my soul it stinks like booze. Even money must eventually decay.  Forget me not!  Oh, is this world beautiful!  Brother, I could cry a rain barrel full of tears.  I wish our noses were two bottles and we could pour them down each other’s throats.

speaker: Marie
lines: On! And on, on and on!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: On and on! On and on! On and on, on and on! (beats hands together) Spin around, roll around.  Why doesn’t god blow out the sun so that everything can roll around in lust, man and woman, man and beast.  They’ll do it in broad daylight, they’ll do it on our hands, like flies. Woman! That woman is hot, hot!  On and on, on and on.  The bastard! Look how he’s grabbing her, grabbing her body!  (Drum Major and Marie exit) He-­‐he’s got her now, like I used to have her!  (He starts to leave, bumps into Journeyman) Journeyman 2: (Knocking Woyzeck to the floor – places foot on him) Brothers and Sisters, our sermon for today is……Think upon the Wanderer!  Yet when the wanderer stands learning against the stream of time and/or gives answer in the wisdom of god, asking himself:  Why does man exist? Why does man exist? But verily I say unto you: how could the farmer, the machinist, the shoemaker, the doctor exist if god hadn’t given man a feeling of shame? How could the soldier exist, if men didn’t feel the necessity of killing on another? Therefore, do not ye despair, yes, yes, life is lovely and fine, yet all that is earthly is passing, even money must eventually decay.  In conclusion, my dear friends, let us piss crosswise so that a Jew will die.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: On and on!  On and on!  Shh!  Music!

speaker: Crowd
lines: (Whispered) Stab – stab

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Ha? What? What are you saying?

speaker: Crowd
lines: (Whispered) The bitch – stab – hot –stab!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Stab – stab the bitch to death? Should I? Must I?

speaker: Crowd
lines: (Whispered) On and on, stab, stab, on and on, the woman is hot!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Do I hear it over there, is the wind saying it too?  It goes on and on – stab her to death……to death. Drum Major: (reenters with Marie – clearly the moment after) I’m a man. A man, you hear?  Who wants to play? If you’re not drunk as a lord, stay away from me.  I’ll shove your nose up your ass.  I’ll……(to woyzeck) Man, have a drink.  A man gotta drink.  I wish the world was booze, booze.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (Whistles) Drum Major: You bastard, you want me to pull you tongue out of you throat and wrap it around you?  (Major beats on Woyzeck) You want me to leave you enough breath to fart with? Drum Major: He thinks he’s so great. Ha!  (Sings)

speaker: Onlooker
lines: He sure go his.

speaker: Margaret
lines: He’s bleeding

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: One thing after another.  (Lies down to sleep)

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Andres? Andres?  I can’t sleep.  When I close my eyes, everything starts turning, and I hear the fiddles, on and on, and there’s a voice from the wall.  Don’t you hear anything?

speaker: Andres
lines: Oh yeah.  Let them dance!  God bless us, amen. (Tries to sleep)

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: It keeps saying: Stab, Stab! And it floats between my eyes like a knife.

speaker: Andres
lines: Drink some brandy with a painkiller in it. That’ll cut your fever.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: The pistol costs too much.

speaker: Pawnbroker
lines: Well, do you want it or don’t you.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: How much is the knife?

speaker: Pawnbroker
lines: It’s good and straight.  You want to cut your throat with it? Well, how about it?  I’ll give it to you as cheap as anybody else.  Your death’ll be cheap – but not for nothing.  How about it?  You’ll have an economical death.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: That can cut more than just bread.

speaker: Pawnbroker
lines: Two cents.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: There (exits)

speaker: Pawnbroker
lines: There!  Like it was nothing.  But it’s money.  The dog.

speaker: Marie
lines: (Leafs though the Bible) “ And no guile is found in his mouth”……My God! My God!  Don’t look at me. (Pages further) “And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery, and set her in the midst…….and Jesus said unto her, ‘Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.’” (Clasps her hands together) My god!  My God, I can’t.  God, just give me enough strength to pray.  (Child comes to her) You are like a knife in my heart.  Margaret, he’s sunning himself.

speaker: Margaret
lines: (pulls the child away from Marie and reads from a Fairy Tale book pointing to pictures) This one has a golden crown – he’s a king. Tomorrow I’ll go get the queen’s child.  Blood sausage says, come on, liver sausage, come on. (They continue is silence)

speaker: Marie
lines: Franz hasn’t come, not yesterday, not today.  It’s getting hot in here. “And stood at his feet weeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and did wipe them with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with ointment.” (Beats her chest) It’s all dead! Savior, Savior, I wish I could anoint your feet.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: This jacket isn’t part of the uniform, Andres.  You can use it, Andres.  The crucifix is my sister’s – so’s the little ring. I’ve got an icon, too – two hearts in beautiful gold.  It was in my mothers Bible, and it says: (continues) My mother can only feel the sun shining on her hands now. That doesn’t matter.

speaker: Andres
lines: (Blankly, answers to everything) Yeah.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (Pulls out a piece of paper) Friedrich Johann Franz Woyzeck, soldier, rifleman in the second regiment, second battalion, fourth company, born on the Feast of the Annunciation.  Today I’m thirty years, seven months, and twelve days old.

speaker: Andres
lines: Franz, you better go to the infirmity.  You poor guy – drink brandy with a painkiller in it.  That’ll kill the fever.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: You know, Andres, when the carpenter nails those boards together, nobody knows who’s going to be lying between them.

speaker: Doctor
lines: Gentlemen, I am on the roof like David when he say Bathsheba, but all I see are panties hanging in the garden of the girls’ boarding house.  Gentlemen, we are dealing with the important question of the relationship of subject to object. If we take only on the things in which the organic self-­‐affirmation of the Divine manifests itself to such a high degree, to the planetary system…. gentlemen, if I throw  a cat out of the window, how will it relate to the centrum gravitationis and to its own instinct? Hey Woyzeck? (shouts) Woyzeck!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Doctor, I’ve got the shivers.

speaker: Doctor
lines: (elated) Say, that’s wonderful Woyzeck!  Gentlemen, take note of this man – for half a year he hasn’t eaten anything but peas. Nothing at all, except peas!  Notice the result.  Feel how uneven his pulse is.  (They all come to feel Woyzeck) There – and the eyes.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Doctor, everything’s getting black.  (Sits)

speaker: Doctor
lines: Courage!  Just a few more days, Woyzeck, and then it’ll be all over.  Fell him gentlemen, feel him.  (students feel his temples, pulse, and chest.) Apropos, Woyzeck wiggle your ears for the gentlemen.  I meant to show it to you before.  He uses two muscles.  Come on, hop to it!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Doctor, please I…….

speaker: Doctor
lines: You dog, do I have to wiggle them for you?  Are you going to act like the cat?  This, gentlemen, represents a transition to the donkey, the ass, frequently resulting from being brought up by women and from the use of the mother tongue.  How much hair has your mother pulled out for a tender memory? It’s gotten very thin over the past six months. Yes, the peas, gentlemen.

speaker: Margaret
lines: I don’t like it! Woman 1: What do you want, anyway? Woman 2: Why’d you start it? Woman 1: Yeah, why?

speaker: Margaret
lines: Because! Woman 2: Why because?

speaker: Gypsy
lines: Who’s going to sing it?

speaker: Margaret
lines: I can’t, I wont’, you all can go to hell!

speaker: Marie
lines: (To women 1) You can, you know you can!

speaker: Marie
lines: (cutting them off – to the Gypsy) My friend, tell us a story.

speaker: Gypsy
lines: (places the child on her lap) Well, here we are now.  Once upon a time, there was a poor little child with no father and no mother. Everything was dead, and no one was left in the whole world. Everything was dead, and the child went and cried day and night.  And since nobody was left on the earth, he wanted to go up to the heavens, ‘cause the moon was looking at him so friendly, and when he finally got to the moon, the moon was a piece of rotten wood, and then he went to the sun, and when he got there, the sun was a wilted sunflower, and when he got to the starts, they were little golden flies stuck up there like the shrike sticks them on the blackthorn;  and when he wanted to go back down to the earth, the earth was an upset piss pot, and the child was all alone, and he sat down and cried, and there he sits to this day all alone. (Woyzeck enters breathless, sweating – child comes to him.  He ignores the Woyzeck: Marie!

speaker: Marie
lines: (Startled) What is it?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Marie, we have to go.  It’s time.

speaker: Marie
lines: Where to?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: How do I know?

speaker: Marie
lines: That must be the town back there.  It’s dark.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Stay here.  Come on, sit down.

speaker: Marie
lines: But I have to get back.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: You won’t get sore feet.

speaker: Marie
lines: What’s gotten into you.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Do you know how long it’s been Marie?

speaker: Marie
lines: Two years since Pentecost.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Do you know how long it’s going to be?

speaker: Marie
lines: I’ve got to go make supper.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Are you freezing Marie?  But you’re warm.  How hot your lips are!  Hot – the hot breath of a whore – but I’d give you heaven and earth to kiss them once more.  Once you’re cold, you don’t freeze anymore. The morning dew won’t make you freeze.

speaker: Marie
lines: What are you talking about?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Nothing. (silence)

speaker: Marie
lines: Look how red the moon is.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Like a bloody blade.

speaker: Marie
lines: What are you up to:  Franze, you’re so pale.  (He pulls out the knife) Franz – wait!  For god’s sake – help.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (Begins to stab her) Here, I brought this for you, take it!  Can’t you die? There, here!  Ah – she’s still twitching.  Not yet? Not yet? Still alive? (Keeps stabbing) Are you dead? Dead? Dead? On and on, on and on!

speaker: Man
lines: Wait!

speaker: Woman
lines: You hear something?  Shh!  Over there!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (dragging Marie’s body off) On and on, dead, dead!

speaker: Man
lines: Wait, wait…….there.  Did you hear that?

speaker: Woman
lines: It’s the water, it’s calling.  It’s been a long time since anyone drowned here. Let’s go.  I don’t like hearing such sounds.

speaker: Man
lines: Hold…. there it is again.  Like a person dying!

speaker: Woman
lines: It’s uncanny.  So foggy, nothing but grey mist as far as you can see – and the hum of beetles like the broken bells.  Let’s get out of here!

speaker: Man
lines: Let’s go up this way, come on!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (rushes in) Dance!  Everybody!  Don’t stop!  Sweat and stink! He’ll get you all in the end!   (He dances with Margaret) Ho, Margaret!  I’m so hot, so hot!  That’s the way it is: the devil takes one and lets the other get away.  Margaret, you’re hot as coals!  Why, tell me why? Margaret, you’ll be cold one day too.  Be reasonable – can’t you sing something?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: No shoes, no shoes!  We can get to hell without shoes.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Sure, sure!  What do I want to get all bloody for?

speaker: Margaret
lines: Then what’s that on your hands?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Me? What, me?

speaker: Margaret
lines: Red!  It’s blood.  (Crowd gathers around)

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: Blood?  Blood?

speaker: Journeyman
lines: Blood!

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I think I cut myself.  Here, on my right hand.

speaker: Woman
lines: Then why is there blood on your elbows?

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I wiped it off?

speaker: Woman
lines: Your right hand and you wiped it on your right elbow? Impossible! Drum Major: (with child and Gypsy) And then the Giant said:

speaker: Child
lines: “I smell, I smell the flesh of Man.”

speaker: Gypsy
lines: Pew, it stinks already.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: What do you want from me?  Is it your business? Out of my way or the first one who…….Damn you!  Do I look like I murdered somebody?  Do I look like a murderer?  What are you looking at?  Look at yourselves!  Look!  Out of my way!  (He runs off)

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: The knife?  Where’s the knife?  I left it here.  It’ll give me away. Closer and closer.  What is this place? What’s that noise? Something’s moving!  It’s quiet now – it’s got to be here, close to her. Marie?  Ha, Marie.  Quiet.  Everything’s quiet.  Why are you so pale, Marie?  Why are you wearing those red beads around your neck? Who was it gave you that necklace for sinning with him?  Your sins made you black, Marie, they made you black.  Did I make you so pale?  Why is your hair uncombed? Did you forget to twist your braids today?  The knife, the knife!  I’ve got it.  There! (he runs to the water) There, into the water. (Throws the knife into the water) It dives like a stone into the black water.  No, it’s not out far enough for when they swim!  (He wades into the pond and throws it out father) There!  Now!  But in the summer when they dive for mussels?  Ha, it’ll get rusty, who’ll ever notice it. Why didn’t I break it first!  Am I still bloody?  I’ve go to wash myself. There, there’s a spot, and another indeed……keep going, scrub clean, need to go further…….(he moves further and further into the water) Journeyman 1: Let’s go find Marie!

speaker: Margaret
lines: What happended? Journayman 2: Don’t you know? Everybody’s out there. They found two bodies, one stabbed one drowned.

speaker: Margaret
lines: Where? Journey man 1: By the pond, out in the woods. Journeyman 2: Hurry so we can still see something. Before they take away the bodies.

speaker: Gypsy
lines: Looky there, he fell in the water, he fell in the water, he fell in the water.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (reaching out to the Child) Boy……Christian.

speaker: Gypsy
lines: He fell in the water.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: (wanting to embrace the child, but it turns from him screaming) My god!  My god!

speaker: Gypsy
lines: He fell in the water.

speaker: Woyzeck
lines: I’ll buy you a new train, Christian.  There, there. (Child runs out) Here, buy the boy a new train. (Gypsy stares blankly at him) A train!

speaker: Gypsy
lines: He fell in the water!  (Exits opposite of child, Woyzeck alone)

speaker: Doctor
lines: What murder!  A good, genuine, beautiful murder!

speaker: Captain
lines: Beautiful a murder as you could hope for!  It’s been a long time since we had one like this!
